title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.12.5 | 2-08-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyanati Viran Dhasya Gyanan Janishalakaya
Chakshurun Militam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnu Padaya Krishna Prishthaya Bhutale
Shri Mate Bhakti Vedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine
Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Paschatya Deshatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda
Shri Advaita Gadadhara Srivasadi Gaurabhakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskutya
Naram Chai Vanarottamam Devi Saraswati Vyasam Tato Jaya Mudhirayet
In this session we are discussing from the 5th verse of the 12th chapter
of the first canto of Srimad Bhagavatam
Sampadakratavo Loka Mahishi Bhrataro Mahi
Jambudvipa Adhipatyamcha Yashascha Tridivam Gatam
The meaning of this verse is
News even reached the celestial planets
about Maharaj Yudhishthira's worldly possessions
the sacrifices by which he would attain a better destiny
his queen, his stalwart brothers, his extensive land
his sovereignty over the planet earth
and his fame etc
So this is the wonderful description about King Yudhishthira
Suta Goswami is describing
So Srila Prabhupada elaborates in the purport
Only a rich and great man's name and fame
are known as the name of the great man
all over the world
and the name and fame of Maharaj Yudhishthira
who reached the higher planets
because of his good administration
worldly possessions
glorious wife Draupadi
the strength of his brothers Bhima and Arjuna
and his solid sovereign power over the world
known as Jambudvipa
You see
Yudhishthira was so perfectly ruling
He was the emperor of the entire earth planet
and he was the emperor of the entire earth planet
and he was so perfectly ruling
in accordance with the instructions given by Krishna
and confirmed by the saintly advisors in his kingdom
So he was ruling perfectly
and therefore his administration became very famous
that news reached the heavenly planets
We should always remember
in the heavenly planets
They don't really bother much
about what's happening on earth
except when such an
excellent devotee
is ruling the entire earth planet perfectly
except in such cases
the heavenly residents do not bother
about what's happening on the earth
You talk anywhere on the earth
never think it's because of the politicism
ever think it's because of the politicism
The 확진 officer is satisfied
or anything other thanvisioning Registered as an actor
äCe's only citizen pouring out
So, here the word lokāha is significant word that is used in this fifth verse. Sampadaha
kratavo lokāha. Why this word is significant? Śrīla Prabhupāda says there are different
lokas or higher planets scattered all over the sky, both material and spiritual. The
inhabitants of this earth planet, especially the scientists and some philosophers, in the
modern days they tend to think there is life only on the earth planet and this is completely
wrong. There is life on each and every planet in this universe.
Every planet there is life. And there are millions and billions of planets, and the
living conditions on the planets are variegated. There are much better planets in terms of
the facilities provided to the residents of those planets. As described in the scriptures
called Svarga loka, Maharloka, Janaloka, Tapoloka, Satyaloka, Cetaloka. To each planet there are
lives. Even if the answers are in their own language, they are not for everyone. They
are for everybody. So, whatever are the problems, they are not for everyone. For the one who
lives and lives, every planet lives. And there are millions and billions of planets. And the
Satyaloka these are unknown to the so-called scientists and and modern-day
educated class of people they do not know about this but there is complete
very accurate and perfect description of these lokas in the Vedic literature
a person can reach them that is the higher planets by dint of his work in the
present life as stated in Bhagavad Gita 9.25 what is the verse
yanti deva vrata devan pitrin yanti pitr vrataha bhutani yanti bhute jya yanti
madhyajino pimam four different destinations are described for four
different
different classes of people in this world what is that those who worship
demigods they reach the planet of the demigods in their next life those who
worship the pitris the ancestors they go to the planet of the ancestors in their
next life those who worship ghosts and spirits
they attain the above the ghosts and spirits and those who worship Krishna
they are eligible to be transferred to Krishna's planet the top
most planet the spiritual planet so this is the way worship according to the

recommendation in the Shastra so Srila Prabhupada clarifies here further no force full enterance into the neural complex as part of the time discipline but is missed by the body soRespected you to use Cri. Nordic
示ана taught that"?
is allowed there. Just like Srila Prabhupada says, the tiny material scientists and engineers
who have discovered vehicles to travel over a few thousand miles in outer space will not
be allowed entrance into the higher planets. Will not be allowed entrance. Why? Because
they are all governed by natural laws. If we don't follow those laws, we cannot enter
any of those upper planets. That is not the way to reach the better planets. They have
some sputnik, they have some space vehicle and they think by simply travelling they are
going to forcefully enter. No, never possible.
One must qualify himself to enter into such happy planets by sacrifice and service. Yajna
and Seva, Bhakti Seva. Yajna means authorised sacrifice given in the scriptures. Those who
are sinful in every step of life can expect only to be degraded animal life, to suffer
more and more the pangs of life.
Material existence and this is also stated in the Bhagavad Gita, in the 16th chapter 19th
verse. It is stated there in the 16th chapter 19th, word of the Bhagavad
Gita,

Those who are envious and mischievous, who are the lowest among men, are cast by me into the ocean of material existence into various demoniac species of life. So demons degrade themselves. They cannot forcefully enter the upper planets. That's not possible.
Maharaj Yudhishthira's good sacrifices and qualifications were so lofty and virtuous that even the residents of the higher celestial planets were already prepared to receive him as one of them.
So the residents of the higher planets are all pious beings and they are engaged in sacrifice.
They are engaged in seva, in service. They are free from sinful activities. Sin is unknown in the upper planets.
On the other hand, we see on the earth so many people committing sin by killing animals just for the sake of satisfying their tongue to eat some flesh, animal flesh.

So this is not at all proper for such people to think that they can travel by some spacecraft to the higher planets where the standard of living is thousands and millions of times better than the best standard of living on the earth.
So the method is sacrifice, service, worship.
As recommended in the shastra, not concocted worship, not concocted yajna, but as recommended in the shastra.
So the scriptures are giving perfect knowledge about this process.
Yanti deva vrata deva.
Now Maharaj Yudhishtira, he was carrying out his duties as given in the shastra.
But the result of Yudhishtira Maharaj doing his duties properly is that he was able to cultivate the earth in such a way that the earth was providing everything in plenty.
That was described in the earlier chapter.
So this is possible not because of forceful entrance into the upper planets by means of some space vehicle or some kind of spacecraft.
It's not going to work.
As Prabhupada says, they may go some few thousand miles into outer space, but they cannot land anywhere.
That's why they are always coming back.
If they really were to go to upper planets where standard of living is millions of times better,
why will they come back to this earth planet which is filled with misery?
Why will they come back to this situation?
It's because they are not going anywhere into outer space.
Neither they are actually able to land in any particular place, suitable place.
They are simply engaged in
sense gratification, giving trouble to lower animals and committing so many sinful activities, especially killing the cow.
It's the worst kind of sin, the greatest sin.
What do the shastras say about cow killing?
The killers of the cow, they will be punished in hell.
For as many years as there are hair on the body of the cow.
Can you count the body of the cow having how many hair? Impossible.
So that is the fate that is awaiting all these sinful people.
Their future is very, very bleak.
Of course, if they take to Krishna consciousness, then they can be relieved of all the sinful reactions.
That's possible if they take to Krishna consciousness, not otherwise.
I'll stop here. Thank you very much. Hare Krishna.
